list_definition.definition: (also hosepipe) a rubber, plastic etc tube which bends and which is used to carry water etc
an older word for stockings or socks

list_definition.mean_english: rửa hoặc tưới nước bằng vòi
list_definition.definition: to apply water to by means of a hose

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ll go and hose the garden/car.

list_ex_of_english: The decks were hosed down with sea water until free of debris brought aboard from the landing.
They wear culottes and sometimes have parallel gartering over hose or bare legs.
Manufacturers relied on hoses, bumpers and engine parts made with rubber.
The soil was sterilized with equipment constructed from two metal drums joined with a plastic hose; steam was generated using firewood collected locally.
Plants in the pots were watered by hose to supplement natural rainfall when necessary.
So streets and vehicles leaving the site were hosed down and workers at the site were outfitted with masks.
These hoses were used for cleaning milking equipment and washing down the milking area.
Dead seedlings and t hose with wilted leaves were also discarded.
